intro: Higginsia microcarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved higginsia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and rocky areas, adapting to nutrient-poor soils. Higginsia microcarpa is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for local wildlife.
